programme.title: The Protector
programme.desc: Two NYPD cops are sent to Hong Kong to catch a drug lord who has kidnapped the daughter of his former associate.

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: Former heavyweight boxing champion Muhammad Ali is interviewed.

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: Mrs. Georgia Jackson, mother of slain Soledad Brother George Jackson, is interviewed by producer Ellis Haizlip; Latin-jazz sounds of seven man combo, Mandrill; LaBelle (Formerly Patti LaBelle and the Bluebells).

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: Passages from Frederick Douglass' greatest orations, dramatized by Arthur Bufghardt; performances by drummer Max Roach and his jazz ensemble; the J. C. White Singers.

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: Author James Baldwin is interviewed by the young Black poetess Nikki Giovanni; taped in London.

programme.title: Rock and Roll Revue
programme.desc: Vintage clips of great jazz artists.

programme.title: Coming Soon to Soul Flix
programme.desc: "Coming To Soul Flix" features "Arena," "The Big Doll House," "Caged Heat," "Assault on Precinct 13," "The Bad Bunch" and others.

programme.title: The Final Comedown
programme.desc: Out of racism rises a young militant leader (Billy Dee Williams) who thinks the only answer is armed revolution.

programme.title: Assault on Precinct 13
programme.desc: Cops and convicts join forces to defend a barren police station from a vengeance-seeking street gang.

programme.title: The Black Six
programme.desc: Righteous biker Bubba (Gene Washington) and his five war buddies go south to avenge his slain brother.

programme.title: The Guy From Harlem
programme.desc: A streetwise private investigator relies on his instincts to succeed when the CIA hires him to guard a visiting African princess.

programme.title: Abar: Black Superman
programme.desc: Upon moving into a bigoted neighborhood, the scientist father of a persecuted Black family gives a superpower elixir to his tough bodyguard, who thus becomes a superpowered crimefighter.

programme.title: Under the Cherry Moon
programme.desc: News of a trust-fund beauty (Kristin Scott Thomas) inspires the pianist (Prince) at a hotel in Nice on the Riviera.

programme.title: Graffiti Bridge
programme.desc: The Kid (Prince) and his rock-club rival (Morris Day) disagree about music in a sequel to the 1984 film "Purple Rain."

programme.title: City Hunter
programme.desc: U.S. criminals hijack a cruise ship with a gluttonous private eye (Jackie Chan) aboard who is seeking a magnate's missing daughter.

programme.title: Crime Story
programme.desc: A Hong Kong detective (Jackie Chan) teams with a police veteran (Kent Cheng) to rescue a wealthy businessman from kidnappers.

programme.title: The Slams
programme.desc: Rival prison factions surround a Los Angeles convict (Jim Brown) who has $1.5 million stashed on the outside.
